spec.name: context_drivers
spec.notes: Systemic drivers that create blind spots beyond logical fallacies.

drivers.label: Identity Protection
drivers.definition: Defending self image or status, filtering out threatening facts.

drivers.label: Misaligned Incentives
drivers.definition: Rewards encourage behavior that conflicts with the real goal.

drivers.label: Time Pressure
drivers.definition: Rushing decisions narrows options and suppresses diligence.

drivers.label: Overload
drivers.definition: Too much information hides signal and delays key choices.

drivers.label: Complexity
drivers.definition: Interdependent parts obscure causes and sideâ€‘effects.

drivers.label: Groupthink
drivers.definition: Desire for harmony suppresses dissent and alternative views.

drivers.label: Status Quo Bias
drivers.definition: Preferring existing paths even when better options emerge.

drivers.label: Confirmation Drift
drivers.definition: Gradual tilt toward data that supports prior beliefs.

drivers.label: Scope Creep
drivers.definition: Expanding goals dilute focus and blur success criteria.

drivers.label: Metric Fixation
drivers.definition: Optimizing the number instead of the underlying reality.

drivers.label: Handoff Gaps
drivers.definition: Coordination breaks hide responsibilities between teams.

drivers.label: Political Constraints
drivers.definition: Internal power dynamics block rational options.

drivers.label: Access Bias
drivers.definition: Limited stakeholder access skews what gets heard or measured.

drivers.label: Moral Hazard
drivers.definition: Actors take more risk when others bear the downside.
